New Records: Luka Doncic scored a game-high 37 points, the highest by a Dallas Maverick in this game.
The Dallas Mavericks set a new low in free-throw shooting percentage (30.8%) in this game.
John Collins scored 28 points, the highest by a Utah Jazz player in this game.
Key Match Events: John Collins made a game-winning layup with 6.5 seconds left to secure the Utah Jazz's win.
Luka Doncic tied the game with a three-pointer but missed the final shot, leading to the Jazz's victory.
The Dallas Mavericks had a 12-point deficit at one point in the fourth quarter before mounting a comeback.
Pre-Game Insights: The Dallas Mavericks started the game without Kyrie Irving due to a shoulder sprain.
Jason Kidd shuffled the starting lineup, including Quentin Grimes, Maxi Kleber, and Dereck Lively II.
The Utah Jazz had key players like Collin Sexton and Jordan Clarkson contributing early in the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Jason Kidd expressed frustration with the team's performance and turnovers.
Luka Doncic was critical of his own three-pointer miss at the end of the game.
The Utah Jazz secured their first home win of the season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was physically demanding, with several players slipping on wet spots.
Turnovers and fouls were significant issues for the Dallas Mavericks throughout the game.
Others: The Dallas Mavericks fell to 5-7 with the loss, while the Utah Jazz improved to 3-8.
